clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Topical Ketamine on Acute and Chronic Pain, Dose Finding
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Topical Ketamine on Acute and Chronic Post-mastectomy Pain, Dose Finding - Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of addition of different doses of Ketamine locally in acute and chronic post-mastectomy pain after breast cancer surgery and on the probability of developing chronic post-mastectomy pain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: the total amount of morphine consumption

secondary_outcome.description: pain intensity measured by Visual analogue scale

arm_group.description: patients will receive 1mg / kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 % )
patients will receive 2 mg /kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 %) a
patients will receive 3 mg / kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 %)

intervention.description: patients will receive 1mg / kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 % ) and irrigated onto surgical field after hemostats and before skin closure.
patients will receive 2 mg /kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 %) and irrigated onto surgical field after hemostasis and before skin closure.
patients will receive 3 mg /kg of Ketamine diluted by 20 ml saline (0.9 %) and irrigated onto surgical field after hemostasis and before skin closure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American society of heart association class I-II female patients
- aged 18-60 years
- scheduled for modified radical mastectomy with axillary dissection for breast carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- known allergy to the study drugs
- significant cardiac-
- respiratory-
- renal or hepatic disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: lecturer of anesthesia, ICU and pain releif
